common.name: inputType
common.description: Set the HTML 5 input type, some framework may have specific components for some of these type

react-mantine.description: Determines whether check icon should be displayed near the selected option label, true by default

react-mantine.name: allowDeselect

react-mantine.name: withScrollArea
react-mantine.description: Determines whether the options should be wrapped with scroll bars, true by default

react-mantine.description: Determines whether the input should have cursor: pointer style, false by default

react-mantine.name: withErrorStyles

react-antd.name: showControls
react-antd.description: Whether to show +- controls, or set custom arrows icon

react-mantine.name: size
react-mantine.description: Size of the field

react-mantine.name: fullWidth
react-mantine.description: Set the width of the field to 100% of the enclosing container

react-mantine.name: width
react-mantine.description: Set the width (in pixel) of the field

react-mantine.name: pointer
react-mantine.description: Determines whether the input should have cursor: pointer style, false by default

react-mantine.name: withErrorStyles
react-mantine.description: Determines whether the input should have red border and red text color when the error prop is set, true by default

react-mantine.name: valueIsNumericString
react-mantine.description: If value is passed as string representation of numbers (unformatted) and number is used in any format props like in prefix or suffix in numeric format and format prop in pattern format then this should be passed as true. false by default

react-mantine.name: clampBehavior
react-mantine.description: Controls how value is clamped, strict – user is not allowed to enter values that are not in [min, max] range, blur – user is allowed to enter any values, but the value is clamped when the input loses focus (default behavior), none – lifts all restrictions, [min, max] range is applied only for controls and up/down keys

react-mantine.name: startValue
react-mantine.description: Value set to the input when increment/decrement buttons are clicked or up/down arrows pressed if the input is empty, 0 by default

react-mantine.name: decimalSeparator
react-mantine.description: Character used as a decimal separator, "." by default

react-mantine.name: fixedDecimalScale
react-mantine.description: If set, 0s are added after decimalSeparator to match given decimalScale. false by default

react-mantine.name: decimalScale
react-mantine.description: Limits the number of digits that can be entered after the decimal point

react-mantine.name: thousandsGroupStyle
react-mantine.description: Defines the thousand grouping style

react-mantine.name: thousandSeparator
react-mantine.description: A character used to separate thousands

react-mantine.name: labelAlwaysOn
react-mantine.description: Determines whether the label should be visible when the slider is not being dragged or hovered, false by default

react-mantine.name: showLabelOnHover
react-mantine.description: Determines whether the label should be displayed when the slider is hovered, true by default

date.description: Date field, returns a string in ISO-8601 format (i.e., 1972-10-01)

react-rsuite5.name: editable
react-rsuite5.description: Rendered as an input, the date can be entered via the keyboard

react-rsuite5.name: oneTap
react-rsuite5.description: One click to complete the selection date

react-rsuite5.name: showMeridian
react-rsuite5.description: Display hours in 12 format

react-rsuite5.name: isoWeek
react-rsuite5.description: ISO 8601 standard, each calendar week begins on Monday and Sunday on the seventh day

react-material-ui.name: size
react-material-ui.description: Size of the field

react-material-ui.name: format
react-material-ui.description: Check https://date-fns.org library for available formats

react-material-ui.name: views
react-material-ui.description: Available views

react-material-ui.name: closeOnSelect
react-material-ui.description: If true, the popover or modal will close after submitting the full date

react-material-ui.name: reduceAnimations
react-material-ui.description: If true, disable heavy animations

react-material-ui.name: showDaysOutsideCurrentMonth
react-material-ui.description:
If true, days outside the current month are rendered:
- if fixedWeekNumber is defined, renders days to have the weeks requested.
- if fixedWeekNumber is not defined, renders day to fill the first and last week of the current month.
- ignored if calendars equals more than 1 on range pickers

react-material-ui.name: floatingLabel
react-material-ui.description: Show floating label for the control

react-material-ui.name: disableFuture
react-material-ui.description: If true, disable values after the current date for date components, time for time components and both for date time components

react-material-ui.name: disableHighlightToday
react-material-ui.description: If true, today's date is rendering without highlighting with circle

react-material-ui.name: disableOpenPicker
react-material-ui.description: If true, the open picker button will not be rendered (renders only the field)

react-material-ui.name: disablePast
react-material-ui.description: If true, disable values before the current date for date components, time for time components and both for date time components

react-material-ui.name: displayWeekNumber
react-material-ui.description: If true, the week number will be display in the calendar

react-material-ui.name: loading
react-material-ui.description: If true, calls renderLoading instead of rendering the day calendar. Can be used to preload information and show it in calendar

react-material-ui.name: fixedWeekNumber
react-material-ui.description: The day view will show as many weeks as needed after the end of the current month to match this value. Put it to 6 to have a fixed number of weeks in Gregorian calendars

react-material-ui.name: formatDensity
react-material-ui.description: Density of the format when rendered in the input. Setting formatDensity to "spacious" will add a space before and after each /, - and . character

react-material-ui.name: monthsPerRow
react-material-ui.description: Months rendered per row

react-material-ui.name: yearsPerRow
react-material-ui.description: Years rendered per row

react-material-ui.name: fullWidth
react-material-ui.description: Set the width of the field to 100% of the enclosing container

react-material-ui.name: width
react-material-ui.description: Set the width (in pixel) of the field

react-antd.name: format
react-antd.description: Dayjs format to display input value, "MMMM D, YYYY" by default. Check https://day.js.org/docs/en/display/format for reference

react-antd.name: fullWidth
react-antd.description: Set the width of the field to 100% of the enclosing container

react-antd.name: width
react-antd.description: Set the width (in pixel) of the field

react-antd.name: preserveInvalidOnBlur
react-antd.description: Not clean input on blur even when the typing is invalidate

react-antd.name: inputReadOnly
react-antd.description: Set the readonly attribute of the input tag (avoids virtual keyboard on touch devices)

react-antd.name: needConfirm
react-antd.description: Need click confirm button to trigger value change. Default false when multiple

react-mantine.name: size
react-mantine.description: Size of the field

react-mantine.name: valueFormat
react-mantine.description: Dayjs format to display input value, "MMMM D, YYYY" by default. Check https://day.js.org/docs/en/display/format for reference

react-mantine.name: firstDayOfWeek
react-mantine.description: number 0-6, 0 - Sunday, 6 - Saturday, defaults to 1 - Monday

react-mantine.name: hideOutsideDates
react-mantine.description: Determines whether outside dates should be hidden, defaults to false

react-mantine.name: labelSeparator
react-mantine.description: Separator between range value

react-mantine.name: fullWidth
react-mantine.description: Set the width of the field to 100% of the enclosing container

react-mantine.name: width
react-mantine.description: Set the width (in pixel) of the field

react-mantine.name: dropdownType
react-mantine.description: Type of dropdown, defaults to popover

react-mantine.name: allowDeselect
react-mantine.description: Determines whether user can deselect the date by clicking on selected item, applicable only when type="default"

react-mantine.name: clearable
react-mantine.description: Determines whether input value can be cleared, adds clear button to right section, false by default

react-mantine.name: hideWeekdays
react-mantine.description: Determines whether weekdays row should be hidden, defaults to false

react-mantine.name: hasNextLevel
react-mantine.description: Determines whether next level button should be enabled, defaults to true

react-mantine.name: maxLevel
react-mantine.description: Max level that user can go up to (decade, year, month), defaults to decade

react-mantine.name: numberOfColumns
react-mantine.description: Number of columns to render next to each other

react-mantine.name: columnsToScroll
react-mantine.description: Number of columns to scroll when user clicks next/prev buttons, defaults to numberOfColumns

react-mantine.name: withCellSpacing
react-mantine.description: Determines whether controls should be separated by spacing, true by default

react-mantine.name: pointer
react-mantine.description: Determines whether the input should have cursor: pointer style, false by default

react-mantine.name: withErrorStyles
react-mantine.description: Determines whether the input should have red border and red text color when the error prop is set, true by default

react-rsuite5.name: editable
react-rsuite5.description: Rendered as an input, the date can be entered via the keyboard

react-rsuite5.name: oneTap
react-rsuite5.description: One click to complete the selection date

react-rsuite5.name: showMeridian
react-rsuite5.description: Display hours in 12 format

react-rsuite5.name: isoWeek
react-rsuite5.description: ISO 8601 standard, each calendar week begins on Monday and Sunday on the seventh day

react-material-ui.name: size
react-material-ui.description: Size of the field

react-material-ui.name: format
react-material-ui.description: Check https://date-fns.org library for available formats

react-material-ui.name: closeOnSelect
react-material-ui.description: If true, the popover or modal will close after submitting the full date

react-material-ui.name: reduceAnimations
react-material-ui.description: If true, disable heavy animations

react-material-ui.name: showDaysOutsideCurrentMonth
react-material-ui.description:
If true, days outside the current month are rendered:
- if fixedWeekNumber is defined, renders days to have the weeks requested.
- if fixedWeekNumber is not defined, renders day to fill the first and last week of the current month.
- ignored if calendars equals more than 1 on range pickers

react-material-ui.name: floatingLabel
react-material-ui.description: Show floating label for the control

react-material-ui.name: disableFuture
react-material-ui.description: If true, disable values after the current date for date components, time for time components and both for date time components

react-material-ui.name: disableHighlightToday
react-material-ui.description: If true, today's date is rendering without highlighting with circle

react-material-ui.name: disableOpenPicker
react-material-ui.description: If true, the open picker button will not be rendered (renders only the field)

react-material-ui.name: disablePast
react-material-ui.description: If true, disable values before the current date for date components, time for time components and both for date time components

react-material-ui.name: displayWeekNumber
react-material-ui.description: If true, the week number will be display in the calendar

react-material-ui.name: ampm
react-material-ui.description: 12h/24h view for hour selection clock

react-material-ui.name: ampmInClock
react-material-ui.description: Display ampm controls under the clock (instead of in the toolbar)

react-material-ui.name: forceMobile
react-material-ui.description: Force mobile component

react-material-ui.name: loading
react-material-ui.description: If true, calls renderLoading instead of rendering the day calendar. Can be used to preload information and show it in calendar

react-material-ui.name: fixedWeekNumber
react-material-ui.description: The day view will show as many weeks as needed after the end of the current month to match this value. Put it to 6 to have a fixed number of weeks in Gregorian calendars

react-material-ui.name: formatDensity
react-material-ui.description: Density of the format when rendered in the input. Setting formatDensity to "spacious" will add a space before and after each /, - and . character

react-material-ui.name: monthsPerRow
react-material-ui.description: Months rendered per row

react-material-ui.name: yearsPerRow
react-material-ui.description: Years rendered per row

react-material-ui.name: fullWidth
react-material-ui.description: Set the width of the field to 100% of the enclosing container

react-material-ui.name: width
react-material-ui.description: Set the width (in pixel) of the field

react-material-ui.name: formatDensity
react-material-ui.description: Density of the format when rendered in the input. Setting formatDensity to "spacious" will add a space before and after each /, - and . character

react-material-ui.name: minutesStep
react-material-ui.description: Step over minutes

react-material-ui.name: timeStepsHours
react-material-ui.description: The time steps between two time unit options. For example, if timeStep.minutes = 8, then the available minute options will be [0, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40, 48, 56]

react-bootstrap.description: Fixed heading text

react-bootstrap.name: postfix
react-bootstrap.description: Fixed trailing text

react-antd.name: fullWidth
react-antd.description: Set the width of the field to 100% of the enclosing container

react-antd.name: width
react-antd.description: Set the width (in pixel) of the field

react-antd.name: preserveInvalidOnBlur
react-antd.description: Not clean input on blur even when the typing is invalidate

react-antd.name: inputReadOnly
react-antd.description: Set the readonly attribute of the input tag (avoids virtual keyboard on touch devices)

react-antd.name: needConfirm
react-antd.description: Need click confirm button to trigger value change. Default false when multiple

react-mantine.name: size
react-mantine.description: Size of the field

react-mantine.name: valueFormat
react-mantine.description: Dayjs format to display input value, "DD/MM/YYYY HH:mm" by default. Check https://day.js.org/docs/en/display/format for reference

react-mantine.name: firstDayOfWeek
react-mantine.description: number 0-6, 0 - Sunday, 6 - Saturday, defaults to 1 - Monday

react-mantine.name: hideOutsideDates
react-mantine.description: Determines whether outside dates should be hidden, defaults to false

react-mantine.name: labelSeparator
react-mantine.description: Separator between range value

react-mantine.name: fullWidth
react-mantine.description: Set the width of the field to 100% of the enclosing container

react-mantine.name: width
react-mantine.description: Set the width (in pixel) of the field

react-mantine.name: dropdownType
react-mantine.description: Type of dropdown, defaults to popover

react-mantine.name: allowDeselect
react-mantine.description: Determines whether user can deselect the date by clicking on selected item, applicable only when type="default"

react-mantine.name: clearable
react-mantine.description: Determines whether input value can be cleared, adds clear button to right section, false by default

react-mantine.name: hideWeekdays
react-mantine.description: Determines whether weekdays row should be hidden, defaults to false

react-mantine.name: hasNextLevel
react-mantine.description: Determines whether next level button should be enabled, defaults to true

react-mantine.name: maxLevel
react-mantine.description: Max level that user can go up to (decade, year, month), defaults to decade

react-mantine.name: numberOfColumns
react-mantine.description: Number of columns to render next to each other

react-mantine.name: columnsToScroll
react-mantine.description: Number of columns to scroll when user clicks next/prev buttons, defaults to numberOfColumns

react-mantine.name: withCellSpacing
react-mantine.description: Determines whether controls should be separated by spacing, true by default

react-mantine.name: pointer
react-mantine.description: Determines whether the input should have cursor: pointer style, false by default

react-mantine.name: withErrorStyles
react-mantine.description: Determines whether the input should have red border and red text color when the error prop is set, true by default

common.name: name
common.description: The name of the field and the key of the JSON

common.name: hidden
common.description: Hides the field from the form

react-material-ui.name: centered
react-material-ui.description: If true, the tabs are centered. This prop is intended for large views

react-material-ui.name: fullWidth
react-material-ui.description: Will make the tabs grow to use all the available space

react-bootstrap.name: transition
react-bootstrap.description: Sets a default animation strategy for all children

react-bootstrap.name: fill
react-bootstrap.description: Have all Tabss proportionately fill all available width

react-bootstrap.name: justify
react-bootstrap.description: Have all Tabs evenly fill all available width

react-mantine.name: grow
react-mantine.description: Determines whether tabs should take all available space, false by default

react-mantine.name: activateTabWithKeyboard
react-mantine.description: Determines whether tab should be activated with arrow key press, true by default

react-mantine.name: allowTabDeactivation
react-mantine.description: Determines whether tab can be deactivated, false by default

react-mantine.name: autoContrast
react-mantine.description: Determines whether icon color with filled variant should depend on background-color. If luminosity of the color prop is less than theme.luminosityThreshold, then theme.white will be used for text color, otherwise theme.black. Overrides theme.autoContrast.

react-mantine.name: inverted
react-mantine.description: Determines whether tabs should have inverted styles, false by default

react-mantine.name: keepMounted
react-mantine.description: If set to false, Tabs.Panel content will be unmounted when the associated tab is not active, true by default

react-mantine.name: loop
react-mantine.description: Determines whether arrow key presses should loop though items (first to last and last to first), true by default

radio-tile.description: Radio control with card, description and icon

react-mantine.name: multiple
react-mantine.description: Determines whether user can pick more than one file, false by default

react-mantine.name: pointer
react-mantine.description: Determines whether the input should have cursor: pointer style, false by default

react-mantine.name: withErrorStyles
react-mantine.description: Determines whether the input should have red border and red text color when the error prop is set, true by default

buttons-toggle-group.label: Toggle Buttons
buttons-toggle-group.description: List of toggle buttons, works like a radio group, returns an array of string

common.description: Disables and greys out the field

react-antd.name: stepsType
react-antd.description: Change the layout of the steps, some optoions not available for type "inline"

react-mantine.name: size
react-mantine.description: Size of the field

react-mantine.name: iconPosition
react-mantine.description: Icon position relative to the step body, "left" by default

react-mantine.name: iconSize
react-mantine.description: Determines whether steps should wrap to the next line if no space is available, true by default

react-mantine.name: wrap
react-mantine.description: Determines whether steps should wrap to the next line if no space is available, true by default

react-mantine.name: allowStepClick
react-mantine.description: Set to false to disable clicks on step

react-mantine.name: allowStepSelect
react-mantine.description: Should step selection be allowed

react-mantine.name: autoContrast
react-mantine.description: Determines whether icon color with filled variant should depend on background-color. If luminosity of the color prop is less than theme.luminosityThreshold, then theme.white will be used for text color, otherwise theme.black. Overrides theme.autoContrast.

react-rsuite5.name: size
react-rsuite5.description: Size of the field

react-rsuite5.name: fullWidth
react-rsuite5.description: Set the width of the field to 100% of the enclosing container

react-rsuite5.name: width
react-rsuite5.description: Set the width (in pixel) of the field

react-rsuite5.name: editable
react-rsuite5.description: Rendered as an input, the date can be entered via the keyboard

react-rsuite5.name: oneTap
react-rsuite5.description: One click to complete the selection date

react-rsuite5.name: showMeridian
react-rsuite5.description: Display hours in 12 format

react-material-ui.name: size
react-material-ui.description: Size of the field

react-material-ui.name: format
react-material-ui.description: Check https://date-fns.org library for available formats

react-material-ui.name: floatingLabel
react-material-ui.description: Show floating label for the control

react-material-ui.name: ampm
react-material-ui.description: 12h/24h view for hour selection clock

react-material-ui.name: ampmInClock
react-material-ui.description: Display ampm controls under the clock (instead of in the toolbar)

react-material-ui.name: forceMobile
react-material-ui.description: Force mobile component

react-material-ui.name: closeOnSelect
react-material-ui.description: If true, the popover or modal will close after submitting the full date.

react-material-ui.name: disableFuture
react-material-ui.description: If true, disable values after the current date for date components, time for time components and both for date time components.

react-material-ui.name: disableOpenPicker
react-material-ui.description: If true, the open picker button will not be rendered (renders only the field)

react-material-ui.name: disablePast
react-material-ui.description: If true, disable values before the current date for date components, time for time components and both for date time components

react-material-ui.name: fullWidth
react-material-ui.description: Set the width of the field to 100% of the enclosing container

react-material-ui.name: width
react-material-ui.description: Set the width (in pixel) of the field

react-material-ui.name: formatDensity
react-material-ui.description: Density of the format when rendered in the input. Setting formatDensity to "spacious" will add a space before and after each /, - and . character

react-material-ui.name: minutesStep
react-material-ui.description: Step over minutes

react-material-ui.name: timeStepsHours
react-material-ui.description: The time steps between two time unit options. For example, if timeStep.minutes = 8, then the available minute options will be [0, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40, 48, 56]

react-antd.name: format
react-antd.description: Dayjs format to display input value, "HH:mm:ss" by default. Check https://day.js.org/docs/en/display/format for reference

react-antd.name: hideDisabledOptions
react-antd.description: Whether hide the options that can not be selected

react-antd.name: inputReadOnly
react-antd.description: Set the readonly attribute of the input tag (avoids virtual keyboard on touch devices)

react-antd.name: needConfirm
react-antd.description: Need click confirm button to trigger value change

react-antd.name: showNow
react-antd.description: Whether to show Now button on panel

react-antd.name: use12Hours
react-antd.description: Display as 12 hours format, with default format h:mm:ss a

react-mantine.name: size
react-mantine.description: Size of the field

react-mantine.name: fullWidth
react-mantine.description: Set the width of the field to 100% of the enclosing container

react-mantine.name: width
react-mantine.description: Set the width (in pixel) of the field

react-mantine.name: withSeconds
react-mantine.description: Determines whether seconds input should be rendered

react-mantine.name: pointer
react-mantine.description: Determines whether the input should have cursor: pointer style, false by default

react-mantine.name: showBrowserPicker
react-mantine.description: Show browser native picker (if supported)

hidden.label: Hidden
hidden.name: hidden
hidden.description: Hidden field, just a placeholder for data, component will not be visible in the form (only during design)
